means.word_mean: 历史（指历史记载或历史传说）</seg>

entry.def: You can refer to the events of the past as history. You can also refer to the past events which concern a particular topic or place as its history.

example.ex: The Catholic Church has played a prominent role throughout Polish history.
example.tran: 天主教会在整个波兰历史上曾发挥过举足轻重的作用。

example.ex: ...the most evil mass killer in history.
example.tran: 历史上最令人发指的屠杀狂徒

entry.def: History is a subject studied in schools, colleges, and universities that deals with events that have happened in the past.
A history is an account of events that have happened in the past.
entry.tran: 过去事件的记载;发展史

example.ex: ...his magnificent history of broadcasting in Canada.
example.tran: 他在加拿大辉煌的播音史

example.ex: ...oral histories taken from elderly people in Rochester.
example.tran: 罗切斯特老一辈人的口述史

entry.def: If a person or a place has a history of something, it has been very common or has happened frequently in their past.

example.ex: He had a history of drink problems...
The boy's mother had a history of abusing her children.
example.tran: 男孩的母亲过去常虐待自己的孩子。

entry.def: Someone's history is the set of facts that are known about their past.

example.ex: He couldn't get a new job because of his medical history.
example.tran: 由于他的病史，他无法找到新的工作。

example.ex: ...an exhibition documenting the personal history of Anne Frank.
example.tran: 安妮·弗兰克生平资料展

entry.def: If you say that an event, thing, or person is history, you mean that they are no longer important.
entry.tran: 历史的陈迹;（无关紧要的）往事

example.tran: 夏洛特敦协定已成为历史。

entry.def: If you are telling someone about an event and say the rest is history, you mean that you do not need to tell them what happened next because everyone knows about it already.
entry.tran: 接下来的事就世人皆知了

example.ex: We met at college, the rest is history.
example.tran: 我们是在上大学时认识的，接下来的事大家都知道了。

sentences.sentence: "a critical time in the school's history"

means.word_mean: 2. the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present and even into the future;
3. a record or narrative description of past events;

sentences.sentence: "he gave an inaccurate account of the plot to kill the president"

means.word_mean: 4. the discipline that records and interprets past events involving human beings;
5. all that is remembered of the past as preserved in writing; a body of knowledge;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also as a verb): via Latin from Greek historia 'finding out, narrative, history', from histōr 'learned, wise man', from an Indo-European root shared by wit

sentences.cn: 博厄斯认为任何社会的文化都必须被理解为某一独特历史时期的产物，而非属于某一更加广义的进化阶段或文化类型的许多文化之一。
sentences.en: Boas felt that the culture of any society must be understood as the result of a unique history and not as one of many cultures belonging to a broader evolutionary stage or type of culture.

sentences.cn: 这些学科即将过时:22%的美国大学毕业生主修商务，与之相比，只有 2% 主修历史，4%主修英语。
sentences.en: These are disciplines that are going out of style: 22% of American college graduates now major in business compared with only 2% in history and 4% in English.

sentences.cn: 虽然他们声称自己是民族团结的象征，但是他们的历史和他们现在偶尔的行为举止，还是体现了过时的、不合理的特权及不平等的现象。
sentences.en: Symbolic of national unity as they claim to be, their very history—and sometimes the way they behave today – embodies outdated and indefensible privileges and inequalities.

sentences.cn: 查尔斯应该知道，正如英国历史所示，君主及王室成员最大的敌人恰恰是君主，而不是共和党人。
sentences.en: Charles ought to know that as English history shows, it is kings, not republicans, who are the monarchy’s worst enemies.

sentences.cn: [E] 艾森豪威尔行政办公楼在美国历史上和建筑遗产中均占据着独特的地位。
sentences.en: [E] The Eisenhower Executive Office Building (EEOB) commands a unique position in both the national history and the architectural heritage of the United States.

sentences.cn: [G] 艾森豪威尔行政办公楼的历史在奠基之前已经开始。
sentences.en: [G] The history of the EEOB began long before its foundations were laid.

sentences.cn: 英国維多利亚时代的哲人托马斯•卡莱尔曾写道：“世界史，即人们在这个世界上所取得成就的历史，它归根结底是那些有所作为的伟人的历史。” 然而，现今不再如此了。
sentences.en: “Universal history, the history of what man has accomplished in this world, is at bottom the History of the Great Men who have worked here,” wrote the Victorian sage Thomas Carlyle. Well, not any more it is not.

sentences.cn: 马克思和恩格斯在《共产党宣言》中写道，“迄今为止所有的历史都是阶级斗争史”。
sentences.en: "The history of all hitherto existing history is the history of class struggles," wrote Marx and Engels in The Communist Manifesto.

sentences.cn: 对他们来说，历史本身并没有做什么，它没有掌控巨额的财富，也没有发动任何战争: “做了这一切的是人，是真实的，活生生的人。”
sentences.en: For them, history did nothing, it possessed no immense wealth nor waged battles: “It is man, real, living man who does all that.”

sentences.cn: 因而历史应该是人民大众的历史，是记录他们斗争的历史。
sentences.en: And history should be the story of the masses and their record of struggle.

sentences.cn: 因为：“人虽然创造了自己的历史，但并不是依照自己所想而创；他们并非在由自己选择的环境下创造出历史，而是从过去直接了解、给予和传承的环境中创造出历史。”
sentences.en: For: “Men make their own history, but they do not make it just as they please; they do not make it under circumstances chosen by themselves, but under circumstances directly found, given and transmitted from the past.”

sentences.cn: 对平民历史的记录和伟人传记并驾齐驱。
sentences.en: History from below stood alongside biographies of great men.

sentences.cn: 在 Elop 掌管诺基亚的时候，公司的市值每天都会减少 2300 万美元，使他成了历史上业绩最糟糕的 CEO 之一。
sentences.en: Each day that Elop spent  in charge of Nokia, the company ’ s market value declined by $23 million, making him, by the numbers, one of the worst CEOs in history.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 事实上，其他一些近期研究发现，美国历史上从来没有像现在这样，只有占比如此之少的年轻人想要获得或者愿意接受地方公民组织的领导职位。
sentences.en: In fact, other recent studies have found there has never been a time in American history when so small a proportion of young people have sought or accepted leadership roles in local civic organizations.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 帕劳作为一个(32)独立国家仅20年，拥有环境保护的深厚历史。它是世界最佳海洋生态系统所在地之一拥有1300多种鱼类，700多种珊瑚。
sentences.en: Palau has only been an__ 32_ independent__ nation for twenty years and has a strong history of environmental protection. It is home to one of the world's finest marine ecosystems，with more than 1，300 species of fish and 700 species of coral.
sentences.from: 17年12月六级真题(第二套)| 阅读
